meanings.definition: To divide into small pieces or portions.
meanings.sent1: She morselled the cake into tiny slices for the party guests.
meanings.sent2: The chef morselled the ingredients carefully before adding them to the dish.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel morselled the acorn into minuscule bits, pretending to be a tiny chef.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt morselled into fragments after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The old book was morselled by time, its pages crumbling at the touch.

meanings.definition: A small piece or portion of food.
meanings.sent1: He savored each morselled of the delicious chocolate cake.
meanings.sent2: The picnic basket was filled with tasty morselled of sandwiches and fruits.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy stole a morselled of meat from the table when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a sweet morselled that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The beggar gratefully accepted any morselled of food offered to him.
